Description: Rubus hispidus is a small, herb-like shrub up to 20 cm (8 inches) tall. The twigs are red and have bristles. Flowers are generally in small clumps, each with five white rounded petals. The fruit are dark purple, almost black.
Uses:
A dull blue dye can be created from its berries. The fruit also can be used as an astringent.
The berries are rather bitter for culinary use, and so this plant is generally not cultivated.
